intro: Cissus populnea var. kottoensis, commonly known as the Kottoensis Cissus, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by black, fleshy berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its unique morphology and adaptability make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
